english: I’m going to skip this question.
I’m going to drink some coffee.
I’m going to take a taxi.
I’m going to visit my parents.
I’m going to get her from the station.
I’m going to show him pictures of my dog.
I’m going to cook some ramen.
I’m going to join Culcom to improve my English skill.

english: I am going to change my phone to the new iPhone.
korean: 나 새로 나온 아이폰으로 폰 바꿀 거야.

english: I am going to quit my job.
I like doing squats.
I like talking to him.
I like going for a drive.
I like watching dramas.
I like dancing with my friends.
korean: 내 친구들이랑 같이 춤추는 것을 좋아해요.

english: I like spacing out.
I like working hard.
I like playing tennis.
I like cooking for my friends.
korean: 내 친구들을 위해 요리해 주는 것을 좋아해요.

english: I like taking selfies.
I am sorry about that.
I am sorry about last night.
I am sorry about your girlfriend.
I am sorry that he doesn't like you.

en_hint: I am sorry that + 문장(주어 + 동사)

english: I have a book to read.
I have some food to eat.
I have something to ask you.
I have a car to drive tonight.
I have some information to share.
I have work to finish this week.
korean: 이번주 안에 끝내야 할 일이 있어요.

english: I have nothing to give you.
I have some money to buy you a present.
korean: 나는 당신에게 선물을 사줄 돈이 있어요.

english: I have no words to express this feeling.
I have a secret to tell you.
She said "No, thanks".
She said you are cute.
She said she had no time for me.
korean: 그녀는 저를 위한 시간이 없었다고 말했어요.

english: She said she will come back soon.
She said she will go on a business trip next month.
She said she couldn't come.
He said he would get a girlfriend.
He said he goes to the same gym.
He said I'm his best friend.
He said he got lost.
I have to go to work by 9am every day.
korean: 저는 매일 오전 9시까지 회사에 가야 해요.

english: I have to wake up early in the morning.
I have to take a flight today.
I have to stay at home tonight.
I have to find the answer by myself.
I have to leave my home at 5:30am.
I should fix my bad habits.
korean: 나는 나의 나쁜 습관을 고쳐야 해요.

english: I should buy it at a convenience store.
I should eat more vegetables.
I should respect the elderly.
Sure, I can buy you dinner.
Sure, I can take you home.
Sure, I can go home by myself.
korean: 물론이죠, 혼자 집에 갈 수 있어요.

english: Sure, I can finish the food.
Sure, I can get up early!
Sure, I can run fast.
korean: 물론이죠, 저 빨리 달릴 수 있어요.

english: Sure, I can show you my bank balance.
korean: 물론이죠, 내 은행 잔고를 보여줄 수 있죠.

english: Sure, I can do push-ups.
Sure, I can handle it.
Sure, I can trust you.
I feel like going on a trip.
I feel like lying in bed.
I feel like smoking a cigarette.
I feel like drinking some coffee at a nice café.
I feel like eating something spicy.
I feel like crying.
I feel like traveling alone.
I feel like having a snack.
I feel like running away.
I feel like taking a rest.
I go to Culcom to study English.
I go to Gangnam to meet my friends.
I read books to broaden my knowledge.
I am on a diet to be healthy.
I use this credit card to get points.

english: I hurried to catch the bus.
I watch TV to relax at home.
I listen to music to focus on my work.
I work out every day for at least 2 hours to lose weight.
korean: 살 빼기 위해 매일 적어도 두 시간 운동해요.

english: I registered my fingerprint to unlock my phone.
korean: 폰 잠금을 풀기 위해 지문을 등록했어요.

english: I bought a new phone, and my friend bought the same phone today.
korean: 새 폰을 샀고, 제 친구도 오늘 같은 걸 샀어요.

english: Do you want to come to my house and have dinner?
Today is my birthday, so I got many gifts from friends.
korean: 오늘은 제 생일이에요. 그래서 전 친구들로부터 많은 선물을 받았어요.

english: I can speak English but I can't speak French.
korean: 난 영어는 할 수 있는데 프랑스어는 못해.

english: I ordered food but it didn't taste good.
I go to Culcom every day because I want to improve my English skills quickly.
korean: 전 매일 컬컴에 가요. 왜냐하면 저는 빨리 영어실력을 향상시키고 싶거든요.

english: I'm watching YouTube because I'm bored.
korean: 전 유튜브 보고 있어요, 왜냐하면 심심하거든요.

english: Take care and I'll call you later.
I couldn't sleep last night but I'm ok.
I should go home and rest because I'm so tired.
korean: 나 너무 피곤해서 집에 가서 쉬어야 할 것 같아.

english: I think you should leave her alone.
I think you should sleep more.
I think you should take the subway, not a bus.
korean: 버스가 아니라 지하철을 타는게 좋을 것 같아.

english: I think you should rest.
I think you should never give up.
I think you should apologize to her.
I think you should wash your hands before a meal.
I think you should hurry up.
korean: 너 빨리 움직여야 할 것 같아.

english: I think you should call in sick.
korean: 네가 병가 내야 할 것 같아.

english: I think you should take a hint.
korean: 너 눈치 좀 채야 할 것 같아.

Do you want to take a look around?

english: I am trying to be a good son.
I am trying to avoid butter and sugar.
I am trying to be patient.
I am trying to stop smoking.
I am trying to cut down on coffee.
I am trying to make up with her.
I am trying to stay calm.
I am trying to concentrate on the class.
I am trying to get better.

That’s what I mean.
That’s what I like about her.
That’s what we want.
That’s what they said.
That’s what I wonder.
That’s what friends are for.

english: That’s why I’m upset.
That’s why I like you.
That’s why I left so early.
korean: 그게 내가 엄청 일찍 떠났던 이유야.

english: That’s why I asked you.
Have you ever done Pilates?
Have you ever thought about this?
korean: 이것에 대해 생각해 본 적 있나요?

english: Have you ever started talking to a stranger?
korean: 모르는 사람에게 말 걸어본 적 있나요?

english: Have you ever watched that movie?
Have you ever been dumped?
Have you ever loved me?
Have you ever been to the U.S.?
Have you ever suffered from jet lag?
korean: 시차 때문에 고생해 본 적 있나요?

english: Have you ever tried Irish food?
Have you ever heard anything from her?
korean: 그녀에게 무슨 소식이라도 들은 적 있나요?

english: I have been studying English for at least 10 years.
korean: 적어도 10년 동안은 영어 공부를 해 오고 있어요.

english: I have been dating him for 2 years.
I have been visiting the hotel for a long time.
korean: 저는 오랫동안 그 호텔을 방문해 오고 있어요.

english: I have been using the cosmetics since I was 20.
korean: 저는 20살 때부터 그 화장품을 써오고 있어요.

english: I have been working for the same company for 5 years.
korean: 저는 5년 동안 같은 회사에서 다니고 있어요.

english: I have been staying here while house-hunting.
korean: 저는 집을 찾는 동안 여기에 머물고 있어요.

english: I have been watching the drama.
I’ve been studying for three hours.
korean: 난 세 시간째 계속 공부 중이야.

english: I’ve been doing this all-day.
korean: 하루 종일 이런 걸 하고 있어.

english: I’ve been trying to contact you.
korean: 나는 너에게 계속 연락을 시도하고 있었어.

Will you turn down the volume?
Will you go see a movie with me?
Will you come with me?
Will you meet me there?

Will you show me where the restroom is?
Will you promise not to tell her?
Will you change your hair color?
Will you speak louder, please?
Do you ever feel alone?

kr_hint: 평소에 ~ 하나요? (어떤 행동들을 할 때가 있는지)

kr_hint: 평소에 ~ 하나요? (어떤 행동들을 할 때가 있는지)

kr_hint: 평소에 ~ 하나요? (어떤 행동들을 할 때가 있는지)

kr_hint: 평소에 ~ 하나요? (어떤 행동들을 할 때가 있는지)

english: Do you ever shop online at work?
korean: 근무 중에 온라인 쇼핑을 할 때도 있나요?
kr_hint: 평소에 ~ 하나요? (어떤 행동들을 할 때가 있는지)

english: Do you ever think like that?
kr_hint: 평소에 ~ 하나요? (어떤 행동들을 할 때가 있는지)

english: How often do you talk to your parents?
How often do you go to the gym?
How often do you argue with your girlfriend?
How often do you travel abroad?
How often do you take a taxi to go home?
korean: 얼마나 자주 택시를 타고 집에 가나요?

english: How often do you look in the mirror?
How often do you watch TV?
How often do you eat out?
How often do you order delivery food?
korean: 얼마나 자주 배달 음식을 시켜 먹나요?

english: How often do you get a health check up?
I hope to see him soon.
I hope to walk you home tomorrow.
korean: 내일 제가 당신을 집에 데려다주고 싶어요.

english: I hope to get better next time.
I hope to get a job soon.
I hope to remember that for a long time.
I hope that everything is ok.
I hope that you don’t fail the driving test.
korean: 네가 운전 시험에 떨어지지 않기를 바라.

english: I hope that he doesn’t lie to us.
korean: 그가 우리에게 거짓말 하지 않기를 바랍니다.

english: I hope that we can go on a trip.
korean: 우리가 여행을 갈 수 있으면 좋겠어요.

english: I hope that she doesn’t miss the train.
I agree with you.
I agree with your advice.
I agree with you both.
I agree that he is smart.
I agree that I need to exercise.
I agree that taking a taxi is cheaper.
korean: 택시 타는 게 더 저렴하다는 것에 동의해요.

english: I agree that eating healthy is the key.
I agree that he likes you.
korean: 그 남자가 널 좋아한다는 것에 동의해요.

english: I agree that it’s important to study hard.
korean: 열심히 공부하는 것이 중요하다는 것에 동의해요.

english: I agree that the movie was not good.
I am upset that people forget to say hello.
I am upset that my friend always teases me.
I am upset that I gained weight.
I am upset that he doesn’t answer my call.
I am upset that I don’t have it.
I am upset that she didn’t reply to me.
korean: 그녀가 내 문자에 답하지 않아서 화가 나.

english: I am happy that you got a job.
I am happy that you finally got a driver’s license.
I am happy that it was successful.
When I don’t feel well, I get some sleep.
korean: 몸이 좋지 않을 때 저는 잠을 자요.

english: When I watch TV, I switch the channel a lot.
korean: 나는 티비를 볼 때 채널을 많이 돌려요.

english: When I stay at home, I do my house chores.
When I hang out with friends, I usually go to a karaoke bar.
korean: 친구들과 놀 때 보통 노래방에 가요.

english: When I need something, I shop online.
korean: 필요한 게 있으면 인터넷 쇼핑을 해요.

english: When I travel, I always post pictures on social media.
korean: 여행을 가면 항상 SNS에 사진을 올려요.

english: When I am bored, I watch YouTube.
When I am tired, I drink coffee.
When you are sad, you should eat more chocolates.
korean: 슬플 때는 초콜릿을 더 많이 먹어야 해요.

english: If I arrive early, I will wait for you at the cafe.
en_hint: If I + 동사, I will + 동사

english: If I don’t try, I will regret it.
korean: 시도도 안 하면 나중에 후회할 거예요.
en_hint: If I + 동사, I will + 동사

english: If I meet her again, I won’t make the same mistakes.
korean: 그녀를 다시 만나면 같은 실수를 하지 않을 거예요.
en_hint: If I + 동사, I will + 동사

english: If I win the lottery, I will not tell you.
korean: 만약 로또에 당첨되면 너에게 말 안 할 거야.
en_hint: If I + 동사, I will + 동사

english: If you are going, I will go, too.
en_hint: If I + 동사, I will + 동사

english: If you like it, let me know.
en_hint: If I + 동사, I will + 동사

english: If you allow, I would like to make a suggestion.
korean: 당신이 허락하면 제안 하나 하고 싶어요.
en_hint: If I + 동사, I would + 동사

english: If you are late, you will miss the beginning.
en_hint: If I + 동사, I will + 동사

english: If it rains tomorrow, I will just stay indoors.
korean: 내일 비가 오면 난 그냥 실내에 머물거야.
en_hint: If I + 동사, I will + 동사

english: I would feel a little awkward.
I would get a cheaper one.
korean: 저는 더 저렴한 걸 살 거예요.

english: I would talk to my boss.
korean: 제 상사랑 이야기해 볼 것 같아요.

english: I would get a refund.
I would travel around the world.
I would save the money for the future.
I would drink less.
I would take the subway.
I would say no in that situation.
korean: 나는 그런 상황에서 아니라고 말할 거야.
